channel.title: Comments on: Corona SDK Developer Interview – Jordan Schuetz, Ninja Pig Studios

item.title: By: charlesmckeever
item.dc:creator: charlesmckeever
item.description: @facebook-1497501964:disqus I agree, the Nook In-app purchase limitation was not something I was aware of. With all the talk about freemium's rise in popularity it's interesting to see an ecosystem where it's not an option. I guess we'll have to wait and see how that plays out for the Nook and the mobile app industry in general. Thank you for watching the interview.
item.content:encoded: @facebook-1497501964:disqus I agree, the Nook In-app purchase limitation was not something I was aware of. With all the talk about freemium’s rise in popularity it’s interesting to see an ecosystem where it’s not an option. I guess we’ll have to wait and see how that plays out for the Nook and the mobile app industry in general. Thank you for watching the interview.

item.title: By: Ray Delia
item.dc:creator: Ray Delia
item.description: Great Interview! I enjoyed the discussion on Jordan's experience with the Nook market. Great points about competition in the marketplace since his entry, and about B&N's no-IAP policy and how that affected his options for promotion.
item.content:encoded: Great Interview! I enjoyed the discussion on Jordan’s experience with the Nook market. Great points about competition in the marketplace since his entry, and about B&N’s no-IAP policy and how that affected his options for promotion.

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: I loved the part where Jordan talked about creating an app similar to an existing concept for a platform that didn't already have available options. Looking for gaps in the market seems like a very smart approach to me.
item.content:encoded: I loved the part where Jordan talked about creating an app similar to an existing concept for a platform that didn’t already have available options. Looking for gaps in the market seems like a very smart approach to me.
